pullRequest.body:
add that localization of a flat module is flat.

Co-authored-by: Florent Schaffhauser and Andrew Yang

This contribution was created as part of the AIM workshop "Formalizing algebraic geometry" in
June 2024.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [ea5e5a618d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15023/commits/ea5e5a618de7d7eb897d28dae557f030313e48f7)

<details><summary>

| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.Stability | 1427 | 1431 | +4 (+0.28%) |

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.Algebra` `Mathlib.RingTheory.AdicCompletion.AsTensorProduct` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Flat.Stability` `Mathlib.RingTheory.Unramified.Finite`</details>|4|

</details>

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ localizedModule`
`+ of_isLocalizedModule`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
Can you provide a version with `IsLocalizedModule`? Should be straightforward.

Taking into account the comment about `IsLocalizedModule` LGTM, thanks!

bors d+

:v: judithludwig can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
I've added a version for `IsLocalizedModule`. Could you check the naming of the theorems, and comment on which universes the variables should live in (line 153). Thanks

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10090239855/job/27899243514)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10090239855/job/27899244299)

```suggestion
instance localizedModule [Module.Flat R M] (S : Submonoid R) : Module.Flat (Localization S)
```

```suggestion
theorem of_isLocalizedModule [Module.Flat R M] (S : Submonoid R) [IsLocalization S Rp]
```

```suggestion
variable {R : Type u} {M Mp : Type*} (Rp : Type v)
```
They shouldn't share the same universes. `S` seems to be unnecessary, and they can be implicit.

```suggestion
    (f : M [R] Mp) [h : IsLocalizedModule S f] : Module.Flat Rp Mp := by
```

```suggestion
* `Module.Flat.of_isLocalizedModule`: if `M` is a flat `R`-module and `S` is a submonoid of `R`
```

These results are stated as `R_p` flat. Can you make it clear in the docstring?
It's not hard to provide `R`-flatness as well (Use `isLocalizedModule_iff_isLocalization` and what you have here to get `R_p` flat over `R` and then use `Module.Flat.comp`) and it would be nice if you can do it in this PR but I'm also perfectly fine with it if it comes later.
I don't think we have `R_p`is flat as an `R`-module, unless I'm missing something, so I'd rather postpone this.
`isLocalizedModule_iff_isLocalization` and the newly added `Module.Flat.of_isLocalizedModule` implies that `Rp` is flat over `R`.

```suggestion
  [CommRing R] [AddCommGroup M] [Module R M] [CommRing Rp] [Module R M] [Algebra R Rp]
```

```suggestion
  fapply Module.Flat.isBaseChange (R := R) (M := M) (S := Localization S)
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - Feat(RingTheory/Flat): add localization of flat module is flat
